pr_title: Set a injected CDI CommandListener to the mongodb configuration.

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't we support multiple CommandListeners given it looks like MongoDB supports it?
timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: Agree. The limitation is on my knowledge of how to retrieve the List of CDI beans of a given type. any help?
replies.author: juazugas

replies.bodyText:
Set<Bean<?>> beans = Arc.container().beanManager().getBeans(CommandListener.class); will return all beans of type CommandListener.
Then you can get the bean from Arc by type if the name is null or by name.
You can find an example here but there may be an easier way to do it if you don't rely on CDI but instead use Jandex and retrieve all implementors of CommandListener.
replies.author: loicmathieu

timeline.bodyText: I would drop this method, it's useless, right?
timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: It depends on the above comment (#12082 (comment)). If we need to add a single CommandListener or a full list. But finally it should exist only the one that it's used.
replies.author: juazugas

timeline.bodyText: You already test the caller, I think we can drop this test here and consider it will be called with a non-null commandListener.
timeline.author: gsmet

timeline.bodyText: What's wrong with passing an empty list? No need to check here I guess
timeline.author: gastaldi

timeline.message: Add Test for injecting a CommandListener.

timeline.bodyText: I don't think this is needed to provides methods with and without the List of CommandListener. This method is only used inside the deployment module so it's signature can be modified.
timeline.author: loicmathieu

timeline.bodyText: This should not be needed, just pass the Command listener list as we do for all other MongoDB related classes
timeline.author: loicmathieu

timeline.bodyText: You create a List fo CommandListener in the getCommandListener method so this one is not needed.
timeline.author: loicmathieu

timeline.bodyText:
Having the insertions here is not realy readable for a test.
Can you instead register the CommandEvent in a static List and assert in the test that the event is present inside the list ?
timeline.author: loicmathieu
loicmathieu

timeline.message: Add CommandListener implementors to the mongoDB configuration.

timeline.bodyText:
I see this is done to be symmetrical. But I fail to see why we need build items for that, rather than just having private methods.
Is there any point for the others? In this case it makes sense to be consistent and have it here too.
timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText:
I'm not an expert but my guess would be that in case we use private methods,
we still would need to pass the CombinedIndexBuildItem to the buildsteps, the index lists process would be run two times and also we would be postponing the class name filtering to the Static init phase instead of doing it during the augmentation.
Also having BuildItems and BuildSteps makes the flow more clear about what it is needed to build the final objects.
replies.author: juazugas

timeline.bodyText: Maybe rename the method to addExtensionPointsToNative ?
timeline.author: gsmet

timeline.bodyText: Could we use Class.forName here instead?
timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText:
Ok. Tested on a project with the jar and the native image does not make the difference, I suppose because we do
the initialization immediately after loading the class.
replies.author: juazugas

replies.bodyText:
I'm not sure about this suggestion.

The settings class is from mongodb driver (com.mongodb.MongoClientSettings.Builder)
The MongoClientSupport class has all its fields exposed to getter methods
The private method getCommandListeners is called after the same naming pattern as the getCodeProviders method.

It could be ... extracting the call to the getter function to a variable called commandListeners (very likely to happen in a future PR). For example:
List<CommandListeners> commandListeners = getCommandListeners(mongoClientSupport.getCommandListeners());
settings.commandListenerList(commandListeners);
replies.author: juazugas

timeline.message: Change class loading when adding the listeners.
Add CommandListener implementors to the mongoDB settings.

timeline.bodyText: Can you please add some Javadoc to this class? This is necessary for the All Build Items page
timeline.author: gastaldi
